main event: An unusually bright amber fireball with a tail extending vertically upwards was observed descending slowly until disappearing behind Cockburn Harbor, South Caicos Island.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 10-15 seconds.,The fireball illuminated the entire horizon.,The observation occurred on May 29, 1958.,The sighting was reported by a civilian source.,Evaluation concluded insufficient data for a definitive explanation.
sighted object: an amber fireball with a tail
location: Cockburn Harbor, South Caicos Island, Caribbean
